description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1hh7u","text":"Eukaryotic microbes, protists, are highly diverse organisms with complex cytoskeletal elements used for movement consisting mostly of actin-myosin and microtubules. In order to visualize the cytoskeletal elements researchers may take a microscopical approach based on immunocytochemistry. Presented here is an efficient and effective for staining and visualizing actin microfilaments stained with phalloidin, nuclei stained with Hoechst 33342, and microtubules labeled using an alpha tubulin antibody. This protocol was developed for amoeboid protists, but will likely work on other adherent eukaryotic cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fdc87","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1omp2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fuv8m","text":"Protocol is adapted from the following citations. guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"3of3j","text":"Follow and adhere to all manufacturer's guidelines and warnings. Users must understand the MSDS data for each reagent before proceeding. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fmh1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vfv0","text":"If staining only for Actin and nucleus, and not for microtubules, skip steps 9, 10, 11, 12, and 16.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Adjust the pH to 7.4 (or 7.2, if required) with HCl, and then add H2O to 1 L. Sterilize via autoclave. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":50,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":121,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcd0h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"auof3","text":"1X - Phosphate Buffered Saline (PBS):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90gn4","text":"To a 50mL of 1X PBS solution dilute 5 mL of 10X PBS (above) in 45 mL H2O. Filter sterilize 0.22µm into a 50 mL conical tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":70,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dle99","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eol6p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vps3","text":"1X Serum Blocking Buffer (Preferred Blocking Reagent):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":54},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":54}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pnk4","text":"Serum Blocking Buffer (1X PBS [recipe above] / 5% normal serum [Thermo Fisher #: PCN5000] / 0.3% Triton™ X-100 [Sigma-Aldrich # X100-5ML]): To prepare 10 ml, add 0.5 ml normal goat serum (i.e., from the same species as the secondary antibody - GOAT) to 9.5 ml 1X PBS) and mix well. While stirring, add 30 µl Triton™ X-100. – FILTER STERILIZE 0.22µm, store in 4C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bagpb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48h3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6uq4t","text":"1X BSA Blocking Buffer (Can be used in replacement of above):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":61},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":61}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chdp1","text":"To make a 500mL Blocking buffer: Weigh 0.5 g BSA (Bovine serum albumin, Sigma-Aldrich A2153) [1X = 0.5g in 500ml PBS] and add to 500 ml PBS in a 600-ml beaker. – FILTER STERILIZE 0.22µm, store in 4C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22ptv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"785m6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekmuh","text":"Paraformaldehyde (PFA) Solution (8%): ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20dl6","text":"For PFA recipe please see https://www.aatbio.com/resources/buffer-preparations-and-recipes/paraformaldehyde-solution-8","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":12,"offset":26,"length":92}],"data":{}},{"key":"emc04","text":"To make a 40mL Paraformaldehyde (8%): Prepare 32 mL of distilled water in a glass bottle containing a stir bar. Heat to 60º C on a magnetic heating plate and add 2-3 drops of 1 N NaoH. Add distilled water until the volume is 40 mL. - store at 4º C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"be818","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mqvr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"am2pf","text":"0.5% Triton X-100 in PBS:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r7h4","text":"To make a 2mL 0.5% Triton™ X-100 in PBS: Make a 10% Triton™ X-100 stock solution, add 50 µl Triton™ X-100 to 950 µl 1X PBS stirring well; this 10% stock solution is easier to handle. Make 2 mL 0.5% Triton™ X-100, add 0.2 µl 10% Triton™ X-100 to 1.8 µl 1X PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mpcn","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3e10v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fn92","text":"Primary Alpha-Tubulin Antibody Dilution:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5m6p5","text":"Prepare fresh PRIMARY antibody (1:500) dilution in PBS:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4oi43","text":"For 1000µL, add 2µL of primary antibody (Alpha-Tubulin Monoclonal Antibody (B-5-1-2) = Thermo Fisher Scientific | Catalog # 32-2500 | 100 µg | Antibody is at 0.5 mg/mL) in 998µL of PBS. Store at 4C in the dark. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75h0d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec6a7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fil5","text":"Secondary Antibody Dilution:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tuq1","text":"Prepare fresh SECONDARY antibody (1:1000) dilution in PBS:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58e7c","text":"For 1000uL, add 1µL of secondary antibody (Goat anti-Mouse IgG (H+L) Highly Cross-Adsorbed Secondary Antibody, Alexa Fluor 594 = Thermo Fisher Scientific | Catalog # A-11032 | 1mg | Antibody is at 2 mg/mL) in 999µL of PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":111,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mhbv","text":". references.title: Cellulose fibrils formation and organisation of cytoskeleton during encystment are essential for Acanthamoeba cyst wall architecture.

references.title: Cytoskeletal architecture and its evolutionary significance in amoeboid eukaryotes and their mode of locomotion.

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7l5mq","text":"Ensure Paraformaldehyde (8%) is at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6h35o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"774F3760FC0F11E9AFF0D910DF352A93","id":"51463","label":"","temperature":"-80","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2orsv","text":"Move cells onto a chamber culture slide (Lab-Tek™ II Chamber Slide - Thermo Fisher Scientific - 154461) according to how the cells are being grown, see below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2n7f","text":"If cells are growing on agar plates, cut block where there is dense area of cells. Place upside down on chamber culture slide (Lab-Tek™ II Chamber Slide - Thermo Fisher Scientific - 154461 or Nest Scientific 2 well slide 230122). Add 500µl of liquid media (same media as agar is made) and allow to sit for   to   under normal incubation conditions. Check on the inverted microscope to see if your cells have adhered. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":234,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":306,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":311,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"c6a17","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"75536A60FBEE11E9AFF0D910DF352A93","id":"82614","label":"","pause":0,"preset":[],"start":0}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"78B64470FBEE11E9AFF0D910DF352A93","id":"82615","label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1kir","text":"If cells are growing in liquid media in a tissue culture flask, scrap cells with a cell scraper to dislodge cells from tissue culture flask. Move 1 mL to each chamber of the chamber culture slide (Lab-Tek™ II Chamber Slide - Thermo Fisher Scientific - 154461). Allow to sit for   to    under normal incubation conditions. Check on the inverted microscope to see if your cells have adhered","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":278,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":283,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"75536A60FBEE11E9AFF0D910DF352A93","id":"82616","label":"","pause":0,"preset":[],"start":0}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"78B64470FBEE11E9AFF0D910DF352A93","id":"82617","label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2hp4","text":"Prepare all reagents as listed in the materials section. Prepare FRESH primary and secondary antibody dilutions before you proceed. The blocking buffer may be made in bulk beforehand. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9dcm","text":"If cells were grown on agar, remove agar block gently. Be sure to remove all agar chunks. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ebkv6","text":"Aspirate liquid VERY gently and discard to bleach solution. Add   of liquid media (same media the cells were growing or same media as agar is made) to chamber's side and allowing the liquid to gently flow down onto glass surface. Cells should still be attached to the chamber slide.
